generator.group: Australian Institute for Bioengineering and Nanotechnology

contact.group: Australian Institute for Bioengineering and Nanotechnology

publications.title: Generation of two induced pluripotent stem cell lines from a patient with Stargardt disease caused by compound heterozygous mutations in the ABCA4 gene

donor.disease_description: compound heterozygous mutations in the ABCA4 gene

genomic_characterisation.summary: Genomic DNA was extracted using FlexiGene DNA kit (51206, Qiagen). PCR for Sanger sequencing was performed on a GeneTouch Thermal Cycler (35 cycles, 94 °C for 30 s, 60 °C for 60 s, 72 °C for 2min). Mycoplasma testing by PCR was performed using the Mycoplasma Testing Kit (#091, Media and Monoclonal Laboratories, Harry Perkins Institute of Medical Research, Fig. 1). PCR screening for reprogramming episomes was performed using primers listed in Table 2.
